title: Hazink
author: Hazink
content: Today is Peter Schiff's birthday, and he created a tweet that looks like mockery of the Bitcoin reserve and added a donation address, which, since the time of that tweet till now, $4k+ and still counting worth of Bitcoin have been donated to. The amount is small, but is that not an indirect way of showing interest in Bitcoin for someone like Peter who speaks ill about Bitcoin each time he has the opportunity?

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: In life you have to play the long game. And Mr Peter Schiff is doing so. He's a renowned Bitcoin critic yet at the back of his mind, he has to have some Bitcoin incase he is wrong and Bitcoin wins. Well, Bitcoin is already winning obviously from his tweet without mentioning Trump's stance on Bitcoin and it's effect already. I find the people who are donating to him and interesting set because what is their reason for donating to someone who has literally being against Bitcoin for many years?

At least his son isn't as hard headed like his father, his son knew the future could be different.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: As he claims, its for his "Bitcoin Strategic Reserve". Following the example of the newly formed US government. Its basically like saying: just in case I was wrong about Bitcoin, and Im too stubborn to admit it directly, throw some sats my way so I dont miss out entirely.

comments.author: Mrbluntzy
comments.body: Peter Schiff being a gold lover and investor, he likes to see that his profit from his gold investment surpasses the profit that Bitcoin investors make from their investment, he wants to stand as a competition between gold investment and Bitcoin investment in terms of profit generation. He is refer to as gold advocate because of how he speaks highly about gold but he never stops talking about Bitcoin too, that means he loves it tooHe has opened more than one polls on X to let people vote between the price of Bitcoin and gold which will dump to a certain price and which will surpass a certain price. He has always criticized crypto not just Bitcoin but still yet he has a hidden likeness for Bitcoin which he admitted in his speech last year when he said that " if he had known how big Bitcoin would become, he might have "loaded up on it" If he don't like Bitcoin for once, he wouldn't have publicly admitted to such. He is just ceasing this opportunity to receive some free Bitcoin for himself from his fan. They call him gold advocate, if he loves gold more than Bitcoin, why did he not request for gold instead?    lol

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: I wonder if anyone is dumb enough to send any bitcoins to that address. He probably wonders the same thing and that’s why he posted that btc address. That kind of twitter post is perfectly in line with his personality. In his world he is probably wondering: “If these people are dumb enough to buy bitcoins, they are probably dumb enough to send me some.” I haven’t checked if anyone sent anything but I hope nobody entertained him like that. Even if people might send some coins just to make fun of him, he will think they proved him right.

Thats just what he wants you to think while he is probably smirking about all the free money he is raking in from gullible idiots. We will see if his "never sell" promise lasts longer than his next anti-Bitcoin rant.

comments.author: Patikno
comments.body: Quote from: Hazink on March 23, 2025, 05:49:46 PMToday is Peter Schiff's birthday, and he created a tweet that looks like mockery of the Bitcoin reserve and added a donation address, which, since the time of that tweet till now, $4k+ and still counting worth of Bitcoin have been donated to. The amount is small, but is that not an indirect way of showing interest in Bitcoin for someone like Peter who speaks ill about Bitcoin each time he has the opportunity?On one hand, I feel that this person is embarrassed and finally admits the future of Bitcoin, and I see this as one of the history that will be recorded how Bitcoin silences its critics. On the other hand, I feel that this person is trying to take back his words about Bitcoin with his own method, although we don't know what he really means by all that, but I hope it is true that he intends to fix it. Actually, we often encounter incidents like this before, and I even remember there was a media that tried to sneer at Bitcoin and in the end they stopped sneering at Bitcoin, or eventually they get involved. From here we learn not to easily assume something is bad without finding out more about it.

I can post a donation address and donate lots of satoshis through different Bitcoin addresses and manipulate the fact that people follow my tweets and send me lots of donations.
